text: the last time I was in Barcelona was
when I was 20 during my study abroad
semester in Prague but I may have had
too many sangria's that weekend to
remember much so now I'm happy to be
back here five years and 104 countries
later with fresh eyes and new
perspectives it's time to see how much
fun I can have in Barcelona in 24 hours
with a hundred dollars a quick two hour
flight from Morocco left me in the
Barcelona Airport it's 1:15 p.m. and the
clock starts now first order of business
get cash $100 equals 83 euros first
gotta take the train to the big metro
station then I bought this MetroCard
which gives me 10 rides for 10 euros I'm
heading to my Airbnb which I literally
booked earlier this morning it was the
cheapest private room I found in
Barcelona 26 dollars a night not bad
alright I'm all checked in to my B&B now
feeling good heading to Las Ramblas a
popular tree-lined tourist area
stretching 1.2 kilometers long also
where the devastating terrorist attack
happened three weeks ago I got my mind
on one thing right now
Thapa I took a stroll through la boca da
food market and found a lovely tapas
restaurant nearby it helps to know
Spanish tapas are bite-size snacks that
are perfect for any time of the day
stomach is full and now walking through
the Gothic quarter on the way to la
Sagrada família la Sagrada família is
one of the most stunning and detailed
buildings I've ever seen it's a huge
Roman Catholic Church designed by a
Catalan architect named Antonio Gaudi in
1882 and today 135 years later it still
isn't complete but is projected to be
finished by 2026 I hopped back on the
metro to visit a place I haven't been
before before it starts I smacked a cup
of precious sangria Spain's famous red
wine punch with chopped fruit inside far
out I have arrived just in time for the
magic fountain show and I got my cup of
sangria which is only 3 euros the
tourists came storming in to watch the
Magnificent fountain show the fountain
show is great now it's time to head back
home for an early start tomorrow morning
good morning guys it is about 8:30 a.m.
right now and I'm heading to my favorite
place in Barcelona
it's called Park well another
masterpiece by gaudi park guell is in
nature park that he turned into an
abstract art masterpiece
so apparently you have to be 8 euros to
go over there and take a picture so I've
decided to just walk around and said I
forgot to mention that the city is not
cheap
I've worked up a big appetite all
morning and now it's time for some lunch
I hopped on the bus to a recommended
restaurant from my Spanish friend to get
one thing seafood paella a Valencian
dish made of rice with king prawns
mussels clams and octopus sauteed with
tomatoes peppers onions garlic saffron
and local spices it doesn't get any
better than this it is now 12 o'clock
noon and I'm heading to my final stop of
the trip the beach no trip to Barcelona
is complete until coming to the
world-famous golden beaches
- that's 104 p.m. which means 24 hours
has passed in the last 24 hours
I bought an airport train ticket 10
metro rides one Airbnb room tapas and
beer ticket to la sagrada familia cup of
sangria and a giant plate of pie for $99
and 53 cents and that is how you have
fun in barcelona for a hundred bucks
[Music]
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world
